intro: Ophiorrhiza pykarensis, commonly known as the Kanyakumari sandalwood, is a rare tropical shrub native to the southern tip of India. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant thrives in coastal and sandy soils, often found in the ecologically sensitive region of Kanyakumari. It is noted for its low-growing habit and is considered an endemic species with limited distribution. Due to habitat degradation, it is also under threat of extinction.
